title: Giordano Bruno: Philosopher / Heretic
description:
Giordano Bruno: Philosopher / Heretic - Ingrid D. Rowland [epub]

Giordano Bruno (1548â€“1600) is one of the great figures of early modern Europe, and one of the least understood. Ingrid D. Rowlandâ€™s biography establishes him once and for all as a peer of Erasmus, Shakespeare, and Galileoâ€”a thinker whose vision of the world prefigures ours.

Writing with great verve and erudition, Rowland traces Brunoâ€™s wanderings through a sixteenth-century Europe where every certainty of religion and philosophy has been called into question, and reveals how he valiantly defended his ideas to the very end, when he was burned at the stake as a heretic on Romeâ€™s Campo deâ€™ Fiori
